Dear Mr. Akers:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Employee records.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4113
Section (1) An institution shall maintain employee records for each
Description employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns regarding non approved facility staff
responding to incident.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source for this investigation is DCWL from reviewing
restraint reports from the facility.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility
on March 26, 2024. Chief Administrator reported a Code Green Call
includes staff from all over the hospital to respond to support an
incident on the unit. He reported when a Code Green needs to be
called, the hospital staff respond including nurses, staff on other
units, and security. Chief Administrator reported he was present
during the exit interview for the investigation (2024C0000996SI) that
provided technical assistance that any Pine Rest staff working with
the Lotus Treatment Program youth in any capacity, including
emergency response, must meet all the requirements for a child
caring institution staff. He reported Director was setting up meetings
to figure out how to be in compliance with utilizing hospital staff for
support. Chief Administrator reported he believed those meetings
were occurring.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 26,
2024. Youth A reported she has never been hurt in a restraint but
noted she does not like it when male staff restrain her. She reported
in one restraint, a male staff switched out with a female Security
Guard which helped her calm down. Youth A reported staff will
sometimes call a Code Green which means staff need extra support
from other hospital staff with a youth. She reported that was how
Security Guard got involved with one of the restraints.
2

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 26,
2024. Youth B reported sometimes staff will call a Code Green which
has more staff from the hospital help on the unit.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 26,
2024. Staff 1 reported she is a shift supervisor. She reported one of
her roles is to help support units when they need extra assistance,
such as when a youth is escalated. Staff 1 reported some of the
incidents can be handled by just Lotus staff but if there is a situation
that cannot be handled then a Code Green can be called. She
reported a Code Green has hospital staff from other inpatient units,
nursing, and security come for additional support. When asked about
the restraint that occurred on March 5, 2024, with Youth A, she
confirmed Security Guard did switch out with a male staff because
Youth A was not responding well to having a male staff.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on March 26,
2024. Staff 2 reported a Code Green call is made when the Lotus
staff need additional support to the unit when a youth is a danger to
themselves or others. She reported the additional support that comes
are hospital staff from other units, nursing, and security guards. Staff
2 reported a Code Green was called on March 14, 2024, when she
was in a restraint with Youth A, she was assaulted by Youth C and
additional support was needed.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on March 28, 2024. Staff 3
reported she has been working as a float staff at the Lotus Program.
She reported sometimes float staff will float between units to help
when there are escalated behaviors. Staff 3 reported a float staff is
not always on the schedule as it depends on where they are with
ratio and needs of the youth. She reported if there is ever a concern
that the unit is understaffed, management will come in and work as a
direct care staff to provide support. Staff 3 reported she was involved
in the March 14,2024 incident with Youth A where they called the
Code Green and people from the hospital came to provide support.
Licensing Consultant was interviewed via phone on March 27,
2024. Licensing Consultant reported she completed special
investigation report 2024C0000996SI. She reported she held a virtual
TEAM exit meeting with Chief Administrator and Director on January
23, 2024. Within that exit meeting technical assistance was provided
for the Code Green policy that Pine Rest staff working with the Lotus
Treatment Program youth in any capacity, including the emergency
response, must meet all requirements for a child caring institution
staff. Licensing Consultant reported she stated those Pine Rest Staff
responding to the Code Green must also be within the annual
employee roster for the annual audits. She reported staff at Pine
3

Rest cannot just respond and handle a situation at Lotus unless they
meet the Child Caring Institution (CCI) rules for staff working at CCI.
Licensing Consultant reported she made several suggestions
including cross train all Pine Rest staff and meet licensing rules for all
those staff or designate a smaller number of specific Pine Rest staff
to be cross trained and meet licensing rules to respond in crisis.
Licensing Consultant reported Director had some concerns with this
and the number of people that would need to be cross trained.
Director reported to Licensing Consultant that she was going to meet
with upper management that following Thursday about a plan and
potentially would reach back out to the licensing department. She
reported she told Director and Chief Administrator that this needed to
be addressed as this is a licensing rule. She stated that she told
them that technical assistance is being provided to give them the
chance to change but if it comes up again that someone is working
within the Lotus Program that is not within the licensing rules then it
would be a citation.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024. Director was present when this consultant was reviewing
human resource files of the staff involved with the restraints. She
reported she was aware of the technical assistance that provided in
the prior investigation and stated she had discussions with upper
management about the concerns from state licensing. Director
reported she was not given a time frame of when the correction
needed to be fixed. Director reported all staff that work in the hospital
programs and the Lotus program complete their background checks
by fingerprinting. She reported the hospital staff are never left alone
with the youth in the CCI. Director reported the security staff and
Lotus staff do complete all the required abuse and neglect
clearances but the staff that work in the hospital do not.
Documents Reviewed:
- Special Investigation Report 2024C0000996SI dated
January 17, 2024- Licensing Consultant completed this
investigation. The report notes the following Technical
Assistance was provided to the facility, “Pine Rest staff
working with the Lotus Treatment Program youth in any
capacity, including emergency response, must met all
requirements for a child caring institution staff member,
including being on the annual employee roster for review.”
- MiSACWIS Report 176430218- This restraint report involved
Youth A getting restrained on March 5, 2024. The report
notes, “Resident was showing obvious discomfort and further
escalation with the male staff member on her arm, so a
female security guard switched places with him.” The
4

following staff were involved with this restraint: Staff 1, Staff 2,
Security Guard, Staff 5, Staff 6, Staff 7, and Staff 8.
- MiSACWIS Report 177310229- This restraint report involved
Youth A getting restrained on March 14, 2024. This report was
consistent with Staff 1’s interview. The report notes, “The
restraint was released due to another peer assaulting (Staff
2), and the Jade pod had minimal staff at the time so staff
holding (Youth A) down attempted to pull other peer from Staff
2 while waiting for hospital staff to arrive after Code Green
button was pushed.” The following staff were involved with
this restraint: Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3
- MiSACWIS Report 177310230- This restraint report
described the second restraint of Youth A on March 14, 2024.
This report followed MiSACWIS Report 177310229. The
following staff were involved with this restraint: Staff 3, Staff 4,
Staff 9, Staff 10, and Nurse 2.
- MiSACWIS Report 177480232- This restraint report was
about Youth B being restrained on March 17, 2024. The report
notes Youth B had attacked Staff 4 and was able to steal his
keys out of Staff 4’s pocket. Youth B was able to get access to
the medication room with the key fob, but another staff was
able to get into the medication room and retrieve the keys
right way. Youth B continued to dysregulate, and a Code
Green was called. The following staff were involved with this
restraint: Staff 11, Staff 12, Staff 13, Staff 14, Staff 15, Staff
16 and Nurse 1.
- Code Green/Emergency Assistance Policy dated June
2023- This policy notes that staff will determine the necessity
of initiating a Code Green/ Emergency Assistance call. A
Code Green is a signal to other Pine Rest Staff that additional
assistance is needed in the area. The procedure section
notes, “When all staff present in the Lotus program are unable
to contain a situation that is unsafe, a Code Green may be
called.” This policy does not note who specifically comes from
Pine Rest Staff to help with the Lotus Program.
- Lotus Program- Staff to Resident Ratio Policy dated June
2023- This policy states during waking hours there is a
minimum of one staff to four youth at the facility. For the
March 14, 2024, incident there was four youth on the unit with
two staff working.
- Email from Director dated March 27, 2024- Director provide
this consultant the location of the staff works within Pine Rest
that were involved in the restraints on March 5, 3024, March
14, 2024, and March 17, 2024. There were nineteen different
staff in total involved within the three restraints. There were
four lotus staff involved, one security guard involved, two
5

nurses and twelve inpatient staff involved. Director noted
within the email that none of the nurses or inpatient staff or
security staff are going to meet the requirements for CCI but
are trained within their approved restraint model.
- Human Resource Files for Nurse 1, Nurse 2, Staff 5, Staff
6, Staff 7, Staff 8, Staff 9, Staff 10, Staff 11, Staff 12, Staff
13, Staff 14, Staff 15, and Staff 16- When reviewing all these
human resource files it was found none of these staff had
documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency,
or equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect.
- Human Resource Files for Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4
and Security Guard- When reviewing all these human
resource files it was found all staff had required
documentation in appropriate time frames showing the person
has not been determined to be a perpetrator of child abuse or
child neglect.
Analysis There was a violation found as staff that were responding to the
Code Green calls to support the Lotus Program do not have
clearances completed prior to hire to determine they are not a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. Through reviewing human
resource files out of the nineteen staff that were involved in restraints
fourteen of them did not have central registry clearances completed.
Technical Assistance
Technical Assistance is offered to consider a smaller portion of Pine
Rest Hospital staff be identified that can respond to crisis with the
Lotus Treatment Program, decreasing the number of staff that would
need to have central registry checks, training and references
obtained as the agency noted it would be cumbersome to have all
Pine Rest hospital staff meet the licensing rules. Additionally, DCWL
suggested considering submitting a variance request for references
requirements and number of training hours for the Pine Rest hospital
staff that typically do not work within the program.
Consultation
Consultation was offered to the facility regarding staff completing
incident reports as they are documenting that there is a lack of staff
or minimal staff, although the staff are within ratio of the unit. In
future documentation instead of stating lack or minimal staff, be clear
additional staff were needed so not to suggest the program did not
have a sufficient number of staff working.
Conclusion Violation Established
6

Rule Code Employee records.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4113
Section (1) An institution shall maintain employee records for each
Description employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and which
are less than 12 months old.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff responding to incidents do not have the appropriate number
of references completed prior to hire.
Investigation Interviews:
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024. Director was present when this consultant was reviewing
human resource files of the nineteen staff involved with the restraints.
She reported the staff that primarily work in the hospital only require
two references to be completed prior to hire. Director reported the
human resource team does try to get three references for everyone
but the requirement for hospital staff is only two and for the Lotus
program staff it is three references.
Documentation Review:
- Special Investigation Report 2024C0000996SI dated
January 17, 2024- Licensing Consultant completed this
investigation. The report notes the following Technical
Assistance was provided to the facility, “Pine Rest staff
working with the Lotus Treatment Program youth in any
capacity, including emergency response, must met all
requirements for a child caring institution staff member,
including being on the annual employee roster for review.”
- MiSACWIS Reports 176430218, 177310229, 177310230,
17748032- All restraint reports were reviewed. The following
staff were involved within these restraint reports: Staff 1, Staff
2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, Staff 7, Staff 8, Staff 9, Staff
10, Staff 11, Staff 12, Staff 13, Staff 14, Staff 15, Staff 16,
Nurse 1, Nurse 2, and Security Guard.
- Email from Director dated March 27, 2024- Director provide
this consultant the location of the staff works within Pine Rest
that were involved in the restraints on March 5, 3024, March
14, 2024, and March 17, 2024. There were nineteen different
staff in total between involved within the three restraints.
There were four lotus staff involved, one security guard
involved, two nurses and twelve inpatient staff involved.
7

Director noted within the email that none of the nurses or
inpatient staff or security staff are going to meet the
requirements for CCI but are trained within their approved
restraint model.
- Human Resource Files for Nurse 1, Staff 5, Staff 6, Staff 9,
Staff 12, Staff 14, and Staff 15- When reviewing all these
human resource files it was found only two out of the three
required dated references completed prior to employment.
- Human Resource Files for Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4,
Security Guard, Nurse 2, Staff 7, Staff 8, Staff 10, Staff 11,
Staff 13, and Staff 16- When reviewing all these human
resource files it was found all staff had three dated references
completed prior to employment.
Analysis The facility is found in rule non-compliance as seven out of the
nineteen human resource staff files reviewed only had two
references completed prior to hire instead of three.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Initial staff orientation and ongoing staff training.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4128
Section (1) The licensee shall provide an orientation program for new
Description employees. Job shadowing shall not be the only form of
orientation. The orientation shall include the following:
(a) The institution’s purpose, policies, and procedures, including
discipline, crisis intervention techniques, and emergency and
safety procedures.
(b) The role of the staff members as related to service delivery
and protection of the children.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff responding to incidents have not completed program specific
initial staff orientation.
Investigation Interviews:
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024. Director reported any staff that get hired at the organization
have the general new worker orientation about the Pine Rest
Organization. Director reported Lotus Staff have program specific
training that involves the D.R.I.V.E program. Director reported this
specific training is not trained to everyone that works at the
organization. She reported when someone is hired for a specific role
at the organization they complete the organization general orientation
and then program specific orientation. Director reported training the
hospital staff, nursing, or security that comes to Code Green calls at
Lotus, in the specific Lotus orientation training would be
overwhelming with everything they are learning from their programs
8

they are hired for. She reported the agency does not want to
overwhelm new hire staff and set them up for failure at the very
beginning.
Documentation Review:
- Special Investigation Report 2024C0000996SI dated
January 17, 2024- Licensing Consultant completed this
investigation. The report notes the following Technical
Assistance was provided to the facility, “Pine Rest staff
working with the Lotus Treatment Program youth in any
capacity, including emergency response, must met all
requirements for a child caring institution staff member,
including being on the annual employee roster for review.”
- MiSACWIS Reports 176430218, 177310229, 177310230,
17748032- All restraint reports were reviewed. The following
staff were involved within these restraint reports: Staff 1, Staff
2, Staff 3, Staff 4, Staff 5, Staff 6, Staff 7, Staff 8, Staff 9, Staff
10, Staff 11, Staff 12, Staff 13, Staff 14, Staff 15, Staff 16,
Nurse 1, Nurse 2, and Security Guard.
- Email from Director dated March 27, 2024- Director provide
this consultant the location of the staff works within Pine Rest
that were involved in the restraints on March 5, 3024, March
14, 2024, and March 17, 2024. There were nineteen different
staff in total between involved within the three restraints.
There were four lotus staff involved, one security guard
involved, two nurses and twelve inpatient staff involved.
Director noted within the email that none of the nurses or
inpatient staff or security staff are going to meet the
requirements for CCI but are trained within their approved
restraint model.
- Human Resource Files for Security Guard, Nurse 1, Nurse
2, Staff 5, Staff 6, Staff 7, Staff 8, Staff 9, Staff 10, Staff 11,
Staff 12, Staff 13, Staff 14, Staff 15, and Staff 16- When
reviewing all these human resource files it was found none of
these staff had completed the Lotus program specific
orientation training as outlined in the rule requirements.
- Human Resource Files for Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Staff 4 When reviewing all these human resource files it was
found all staff had completed the Lotus program specific
orientation training as outlined in the rule requirements.
Analysis The facility is found in rule non-compliance as fifteen out of the
nineteen human resource staff files reviewed did not have
program specific orientation training completed.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
9

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
